Title: Associate Manager, Direct- to-Consumer (DTC) Insights Analyst

Lifestyle Brands (the LSB) is a growing house of like-minded brands under the SC Johnson umbrella including Method®, Mrs. Meyer’s Clean Day®, Babyganics® and Ecover®. Headquartered in San Francisco with additional operations in Chicago and throughout Europe, the LSB is home to 650 employees. Together we act as a force for bold, transformative growth with a focus on delivering positive impact for people and the planet. If you’re into pioneering the future and doing good while doing business, come join us.

The LSB is part of SC Johnson, a family-owned company and leading manufacturer of household cleaning, home storage, air care, pest control and shoe care products, as well as professional products. Originally founded in 1886 and headquartered in Wisconsin, U.S.A., SC Johnson and the Lifestyle Brands division are at work for a better world.

The Company's Total Rewards package is at or above industry levels. The expected base salary range for this position is between 106,000.00 USD - 140,000.00 USD. Job related skills, experience, education, and location will be considered in setting actual starting base salary. As a family company, benefits are a key piece of our Total Rewards package as well and we’re proud to provide a comprehensive, competitive, and differentiated benefits program that our people and their families value.

Lifestyle Brands is the tip of the spear when it comes to driving innovation at SC Johnson, and we are amid a transformational change in our business and the way we approach our marketing. We are a house of high growth challenger brands (method, Mrs. Meyer’s, Ecover and Babyganics) and are seeking

a savvy analyst to help us guide strategy through strong quantitative skills and an ability to bring holistic storytelling to life through measurement, data, and technology.

Reporting to the Director of Direct-to-Consumer & Digital Transformation, this role will have a unique

opportunity to pioneer and implement their vision for marketing analytics at the LSB. You should be a self-starter with an ability and desire to build our marketing analytics capability in Direct-to-Consumer and Marketing Media, including selecting tools, defining data strategy, building data architecture and

creating analysis and reports for internal share-outs with cross functional stakeholders and leadership.

You will bring a strong blend of storytelling, critical thinking, and technical expertise and be able to work with minimal instruction and oversight, conduct multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, maintain relationships with senior leaders, and own deliverables end to end. You will think strategically, develop insightful analysis, communicate findings concisely to senior leaders, work effectively as part of a cross functional team, and help us leverage our first-party data as a competitive advantage.

 Build LSB marketing analytics function, including data architecture, processes, and KPIs Synthesize complex data sets into impactful insights and build analytics stories that inform strategic business decisions Build and maintain Looker reports to monitor marketing and DTC performance & drivers across different business, channel and consumer segments Create and own LTV, attribution models, and cohort analysis Lead initiatives ranging from ad-hoc deep dives and root cause analysis to building robust, scalable data models Provide analytical insights and recommendations to Direct-To-Consumer Marketing team to help optimize marketing investment while maintaining profitability margins for the platform Partner with DTC team to aggregate complex transactional data to build analytical tools for ongoing modeling and business insights (e.g., cross-purchase, pricing, shipping) Ongoing site optimization analysis (e.g., drop-off, optimization) Communicate findings and recommendations clear and actionable for employees at all levels Spearhead proper experimental design, and provide advanced analytical support on marketing campaign tests with clear conclusions on test outcomes Initiate the development of measurement models and frameworks to help the acquisition team better understand the performance of their marketing efforts, especially as it relates to incrementality

 Bachelor’s degree in web analytics, marketing, economics, or relevant quantitative fields 5+ years of ecommerce data analysis and consumer insights experience

 Proven experience in data driven marketing analysis, application, and associated technologies that enable media and digital strategiesA data geek. Our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and virtually, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community.

Title: Criminal Intelligence Analyst - USDS
Description:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok U.S. Data Security
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a subsidiary of TikTok in the U.S. This new, security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and U.S. user data, so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span across Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, among other things, at this time, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office 3 days a week, or as directed by their manager/department. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

As a member of the FUSE Intel program, you will work on the Criminal Intelligence team and support the work of Threat and safety, Ads and other teams by developing and managing intelligence leads about on and off-platform criminal activity developments. 

You will be developing strategic and tactical reports on criminal trends and groups, investigating criminal activity, such as human trafficking, drug trafficking and sales of counterfeit products. You will also develop written profiles and conduct briefings for stakeholders if needed on organized crime groups, drug cartels and other criminal organizations active in the United States. 

Duties and Responsibilities: 
- Monitor criminal activity and criminal groups in the US and globally. Research and monitor criminal activities as they portain to the upcoming US presidential elections. 
- Develop criminal activity leads and reports focusing on themes such as gangs and cartels activity, criminal activities around large-scale events (i.e. sporting events, political events). 
- Conduct analytical briefings on criminal activities and groups/ individuals of interest for internal and external stakeholders. 
- Use multiple-sources and research methods such as OSINT in analysis of current and emerging threats to produce concise reports and metrics relevant to Tik Tok platform and overall business operations.
- Develop an understanding of TikTok platform vulnerabilities toward criminal activity and alter on-platform research accordingly. Develop an understanding of criminal groups' presence on social media platforms and monitor TikTok for similar activity. 

Qualifications

 Education:
Bachelor’s degree in criminal justice, public administration, data analysis, journalism, threat intelligence, or related field or equivalent experience in the field of law-enforcement, media, OSINT investigations. 

Core Qualifications: 
- 3+ years of investigative or intelligence experience.
- Deep knowledge of the US and preferably global criminal landscape, including key organized crime groups, gangs, mafia structures, cartels, terrorist and other criminal groups. 
- Experience conducting OSINT investigations and communicating to large audiences the findings.
- Excellent writing skills, ability to quickly summarize findings and present in simple language key findings and matters of core priority for TikTok to large audiences. 
- Experience collaborating effectively with cross-functional entities across the company. 
- Proven track record of managing, organizing, and executing short and long-term investigative projects.
- Ability to manage, analyse, and manipulate large data sets. 

Preferred Qualifications 
- Knowledge of cyber cybercrimes, financial crimes, terrorism and other similar crimes is a plus.
- Experience with a variety of government or industry investigative and intelligence analytical tools is preferred.
- Experience with SQL is preferred. 
- Fluency in a second language, such as Arabic, French, Spanish, Russian or other languages is preferred. 

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

This role requires the ability to work with and support systems designed to protect sensitive data and information. As such, this role will be subject to strict national security-related screening.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at usds.accommodations@tiktokusds.com

 Sr. Data Insights Analyst

Location:

Milwaukee, WI, US

A Career In Beer And Beyond

Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company is to brew beverages that unite people to celebrate all life’s moments. We’ve been brewing iconic brands for over 350 years and are now proud to be offering a modern portfolio that expands beyond the beer aisle.

 We are Talent Brewers with our culture rooted in our core Values. 

We believe in our brands and our people, and that diversity WITH inclusion is the key to a winning team culture. We want you to join our team of brand ambassadors who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.

The Headlines

In the role of Senior Data Insight Analyst, you will be working in our Milwaukee Office as part of the Global Internal Audit (GIA) function that provides independent, objective assurance and advisory services designed to add value and improve our operations. This position reports to the Manager, Internal Audit, and partners with business functions to identify areas of risk, make valuable recommendations to management, and influence positive change within the organization.

This position is responsible for executing the planning and execution of data analysis initiatives within the department by supporting the development, implementation, and sustainment of analytics and data insights within GIA. This role will harness the power of data to fundamentally change how GIA functions as an organization. You’ll work in a dynamic environment, have an opportunity to grow your passion and career within the beverage industry and make a positive impact in the company.

The Responsibilities

 Data Analytics 

 Recommend types of analytics and procedures to apply to meet set objectives.  Demonstrate ability to understand data flows and business processes.  Perform model creation, testing, execution and maintenance of database, scripting, and analytics.  Identify, acquire, consolidate, and manage data relevant to support objectives; develop repeatable analysis methods; and develop structures to maintain analytics knowledge base.  Provide data driven insights that confirms or refutes hypothesis.  Develop & sustain dashboards or decks to support objectives.  Familiar with data visualization tools, (i.e., Power BI, Tableau, etc.).  Able to apply creative and analytical mindset to assess large data set pattens, trends and anomalies.  Demonstrate ability to use available tools, (i.e., Microsoft suite, Visio, PowerPoint, etc.).  Provide preliminary to final data analysis reports, extracts, or searchable records for team, stakeholders, or management. 

Other

 Ability to work in a changing environment while prioritizing and managing various tasks.  Perform special projects at the request of management.  Identify cost recovery/avoidance and process control improvement opportunities.  Promote Internal Audit as a value add to the organization and deliver audit insights that consistently improve the control environment and achieve operational excellence.  Set objectives, drive results, contribute as a team player, and confidently interact with a variety of stakeholders.  Possess good business acumen. Stay current with analytic techniques/technology.

Title: Senior Quantitative User Experience Researcher
Description:
About The Role

We’re looking for someone who’s excited to play an intimate and critical role in shaping the direction of Inflection, focusing on understanding how people use and get value from Pi. This position is hands-on and offers significant partnership with leadership. From market discovery research to rigorous survey work focused on understanding our current users and the category at large, you’ll execute research closely with Product, Design, Data Science, Marketing and Eng that leads to actionable strategies. You’ll be part of the end-to-end journey of how we solve “personal AI” for everyone.

You are:

Humble, hungry, and driven by the work. A passionate individual contributor who thrives on collaboration. A research expert - you have a strong command of mixed methods, but with a strong quantitative lean. 

In the role, you’ll:

Be a strategic peer in making business-level decisions. Partner with our first researcher to set the vision for how research impacts and influences all corners of the Inflection team’s ways of working and our product, Pi. Develop and run recurring tracking surveys to support both foundational user understanding, marketing, product, and even our LLM teams. This will include brand and category tracking surveys, as well as current user satisfaction surveys. All of this will be done with creativity to maximize the ways survey work can impact as many Inflection teams as possible. Develop and run ad-hoc, foundational surveys to understand all manners of foundational questions about our current user and non-user communities to illuminate key, strategic user needs and untapped market opportunities. This work will range in impact from grounding our team in what we know about our users to prioritizing what we build next. Partner with our research team to create a unified body of foundational insights, working across all manners of qualitative and quantitative data sources (surveys, log data, etc). Influence how we surface insights from existing user data, particularly in rich, nuanced conversations of users and AI, and build out the process for doing so. This involves collaboration with data engineering, log teams, data science and more. You’ll flex. Though this role seeks a quantitative subject matter expert, the team is small and at times, you’ll step in to support qualitative research work like usability tests, discovery research, and other evaluation methods to either guide active product initiatives or influence future ones. You know how to do this with hustle, or at scale depending on need. Collaborate closely with product, designers, and engineers to integrate research insights into product strategy, marketing, and roadmaps. Present and evangelize research findings to internal teams and stakeholders in an engaging, focused, and actionable manner. 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Statistics, Cognitive Science, or related field. Equivalent experience is also acceptable. 6+ years of experience in user research. Experience in early-stage or nimble consumer-facing tech companies. Expertise in quantitative methods including survey research (sampling, design, analysis), segmentation, brand tracking, concept testing. Proficient in qualitative methods like usability testing, 1-1 interviewing, etc. Strong experience in statistical analysis (R, SPSS) and proficiency in SQL. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and effectively. 

Employee Pay Disclosures

At Inflection AI, we aim to attract and retain the best employees and compensate them in a way that appropriately and fairly values their individual contributions to the company. The pay range for this position in California, is estimated to fall in the base range of approximately $140,000–$200,000. This estimate can vary based on the factors described above, so the actual starting annual base salary may be above or below this range.

Where We Work

We have offices in Palo Alto and London. We’re currently hiring into our brand new office in Palo Alto. We’re in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Inflection believes in building a strong in-person work culture with the flexibility of focus time at home.

We work on a 6 week cycle. Every 7th week, we convene together in person as a company to brainstorm, bond and build.

About Inflection

We are a small, friendly and multi-disciplinary AI studio creating a personal AI for everyone. Our first AI is called Pi, for personal intelligence, a supportive and empathetic conversational AI. Our studio is made up of the world's leading AI developers, creative designers, writers and innovators working together in a deeply multidisciplinary style to create a brand new class of digital experiences.

How We Work

We value excellence and ownership. Our organizational structure focuses on individual responsibilities rather than management hierarchies. Everyone is expected to lead by doing. We are big believers in the unreasonable effectiveness of highly talented Individual Contributors who are given all the resources, space and ownership to move fast and deliver outstanding results.

Teamwork and generosity are at our core. Our culture celebrates positive challenges, asking questions, learning and actively supporting one another. This mentality of shared respect and purposeful teamwork is key to our success. We equally value all technical and non-technical contributions.

Constructive disagreement is essential. We appreciate when team members challenge assumptions, put forward new ideas, or encourage us to move faster or slower. Openness, honesty and kindness make us great.

Feedback is our ground truth. We have a tight feedback loop between the user experience and our AI creation process. Quantitative and qualitative data drives our priorities. This goes for internal culture too. Everyone has ownership and visibility into key decisions and progress.

Writing creates accountability. Whether on internal communication tools or in team memos, we are strong communicators with a special focus on the written word.

We deeply value time to reset outside of work. We encourage one another to constantly take time to recharge and always focus on maintaining a healthy work-life balance.

Engineering at Inflection

We are a vertically integrated AI studio. This means that our entire technology stack – from large foundational model pre-training to the user interface – is built in-house, with each of the components co-optimized to deliver the best AI experiences. We have built one of the most advanced large language models in the world, based on multiple novel and proprietary innovations.

We believe in scale as the engine of progress in AI, and we are building one of the largest supercomputers in the world to develop and deploy the new generation of AIs.

We wear multiple hats and don’t distinguish between engineering and research. We continuously explore and exploit, creating new and perfecting existing techniques and solutions. User feedback is our North Star.

Our Benefits

We offer generous benefits to ensure a positive, safe, inclusive and inspiring work environment for all Inflectioneers.

Physical office space in Palo Alto and London, along with reimbursements for work from home expenses and co-working spacesUnlimited paid time off Parental leave and flexibility for all parents and caregiversGenerous medical, dental and vision plans for US employeesCompliance with country-specific benefits for non-US employeesVisa sponsorship for new hiresAvenues for personal growth such as coaching, conference attendance, or specific trainings

Diversity & Inclusion

We are building personal AIs that we hope will serve everyone. We are deeply committed to representing the full extent of the human experience inside our AI Studio. This means that everyone from any walk of life is welcome if you have the right skills. We populate diverse candidate pools for all open roles.

ROLE OVERVIEW

Croud is a global, full-service digital marketing partner. Through a seamless combination of data, technology and creativity, our teams drive business performance and long-term growth for ambitious brands

Our Global Analytics department was newly assembled and structured in June 2023. In a short time the team has already proven to be a key differentiator; delivering industry-leading, high-value services that create measurable business impact for our clients.

As a team with various different capabilities, Global Analytics services approximately 40 different clients. As a Lead Analyst, this role will have the opportunity to work with our largest clients at varying altitudes; managing the relationship, guiding the vision and roadmap for our clients to evolve the way they analyze and leverage data to deliver outcomes.

In fulfilling the responsibilities outlined below, the role will consult with our clients, and simultaneously with our internal cross departmental teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Client Management & Growth

  • Client communications: You will be the main point of contact for our clients in relation to all things analytics. This requires a keen ability to distill complex concepts and connect the dots between analytics products (testing, analysis, data infrastructure, reporting, etc.) and how brands or channel teams use these solutions
  • Measurement frameworks and roadmaps: Develop a clear plan for how our clients should measure success based on business objectives, data availability, media strategy, and measurement methodologies
  • Develop a plan for clients to achieve measurement and analytics maturity: Build analytics and measurement roadmaps that closely align with client’s business objectives. This includes identifying opportunities to evolve their approach to media measurement and cultivating credibility and trust within complex organizations in order to gain buy-in for our proposed solutions.

Analysis and Delivery

  • Manage global analytics projects across various disciplines: You’ll be responsible for driving analytics projects forward by communicating updates to clients and channel teams, unblocking obstacles and providing relevant context to the various technical analytics teams.
  • Unlock actionable and valuable insights that drive business outcomes: Leverage an IABI (Insights, Actions, Business Impact) framework to conduct analysis and provide recommendations to our clients and channel teams. This includes applying advanced techniques to conduct an analysis and arrive to conclusions.
  • Translating outputs from advanced analysis and data science projects into actionable next steps: Distill outputs and learnings from advanced and technical analytics projects into digestible formats for clients and channel teams. This may include but are not limited to presentations, action plans, POV’s, and quarterly measurement plans.
  • Subject matter expertise: You’ll be the subject matter expert for our clients and channel teams around brand and media measurement; recommending and implementing solutions that help our clients maximize outcomes.

PERSON SPECIFICATION

  • 5-8 years of experience working in marketing analytics preferably within agencies and directly with clients
  • Keen ability to interrogate, analyze data, and derive actionable insights.
  • Proficiency in working with all types of data including but not limited to web analytics (GA/GA4), media platforms (Meta, Google, etc.), customer (CRM, Salesforce), Amazon, and more.
  • Familiarity with Google Marketing Platform
  • Familiarity with 1P data, Salesforce, CDPs a plus
  • Familiarity with SQL and Python/R a plus
  • You’re an exceptional communicator. You can edit and refine even the most complex ideas and descriptions, and produce exactly the messages and narratives that work for your audience and stakeholders. You’re comfortable translating concepts and learnings into presentable stories.
  • Experience working with digital advertising teams, adtech and analytics (both technically and conceptually). You can hold technical conversations in depth with developers, engineers and data scientists.
  • Experience with brand measurement solutions such as brand lift studies, brand tracking, and working with partners such as Kantar, Nielsen, YouGov, etc.
  • Experience with creative measurement and testing
  • You have a deep understanding of testing methodologies such as incrementality, geo-split, A/B and have the ability to advise when and how clients should test based on question and hypothesis.
  • You’re comfortable speaking to senior level stakeholders (VP, C-level)
  • You’re a problem solver. You have a strong ability to dissect ambiguous challenges and can confidently ask the right questions to land at a proposed solution.

Title: Quantitative Researcher (Mid-Freq)
Description:
HRT is seeking quantitative researchers to join our effort in developing mid-frequency systematic trading strategies. Candidates will apply rigorous statistical methods on a wide range of datasets and implement trading models based on novel predictions of market behavior, all while leveraging HRT’s world-class research and trading infrastructure.

Successful candidates will be part of a growing effort and have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of strategy development, including alpha generation, portfolio construction/optimization and trade execution algorithms. Researchers are responsible for not only prototyping and conducting research into various strategy components, but also writing code to productionalize their ideas; thus, interest and experience in programming are essential.

HRT employees enjoy a collegial and non-siloed environment; candidates will work closely with other researchers to develop new ideas and refine existing trading models.

Skills

3+ years of prior work experience in stat-arb requiredDegree in a quantitative or technical discipline (e.g. statistics, computer science, physics, mathematics, economics)Exceptional academic credentialsDemonstrated ability to conduct research using large noisy real-world datasetsExceptional attention to detail and desire to understand issues deeplyOutstanding work ethic and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environmentStrong numerical programming skills, including proficiency in Python for data analysis and machine learning. Experience with C++ a plus

Annual base salary range of $175,000 to $300,000. Pay (base and bonus) may vary depending on job-related skills and experience. A sign-on and discretionary performance bonus may be provided as part of the total compensation package, in addition to company-paid medical and/or other benefits.

Culture

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we welcome a variety of expertise: mathematics and computer science, physics and engineering, media and tech. We’re a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automation in every part of our organization—from trading, to business operations, to recruiting and beyond. We value openness and transparency, and celebrate great ideas from HRT veterans and new hires alike. At HRT we’re friends and colleagues – whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we’d love to get to know you.

Title: Data Analyst, Senior
Description:
Job Number: R0184739

Data Analyst, Senior

The Opportunity:

As data analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support a mission and use data for good. We need a data expert like you to bring your expertise to help clients make the most of their data.

As a client-facing data analyst on our National Security team, you’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you provide a deep understanding of their data, but you’ll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to make an impact on their cybersecurity mission.

How You’ll Contribute:

As a data analyst on our team, you’ll:

Solicit and engage with analysts across your host client team to understand data flow challenges, gaps in tool or data set knowledge, and brainstorm methods to streamline analytic workflows. Work as part of a team with government, military, and contractor personnel across organizations to research, develop, optimize, test, and document data-related tradecraft, leverage and utilize data source acquisitions and accesses, and troubleshoot data flow issues related to mission needs. Generate solutions through the collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets.  Apply consulting and communication skills and data analytics expertise by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.  Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as Python, and Microsoft Office Suite.  Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions. Use your data analytics expertise to support client and stakeholder relationships.  Explore, propose, and justify the use of new data sources to customers. Explain currently available data sources’ ability to enhance mission outcomes.


Work with us to drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

Experience with classified, collateral, and OSINT data sources and query functionalitiesExperience developing fingerprints, microplugins, analytics, and notebooks using client discovery and analytic toolsExperience converting data into various formats and preserving meaningExperience as a cyber analyst, including TDNA or DNEAKnowledge of Python and regexAbility to select data, join, and enrich various datasetsAbility to communicate technical information and recommendations to peers, engineers, and analytic customersTS/SCI clearance with a polygraphHS diploma or GED and 6+ years of experience with data analysis, or Bachelor’s degree


Nice If You Have: 

Knowledge of NiagaraFiles


Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
